title: Tax payers full cost for immigration within sheffield borders

Dear Sheffield City Council,
I would like the information,for the tax payers  costs for housing and the use of council and  private properties, NHS services, and benefits for immigration/immigrants, within sheffield borders

Ian Turner

Dear Ian Turner,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Taxpayers full cost
for immigration within Sheffield borders which we received on 22/03/2025.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
As there are no single definitions of the terms in law, ‘immigrant’ and
‘migrant’ are often used interchangeably.
The IRC (International Rescue Committee [1]www.rescue.org) define an
immigrant as ‘someone who has left their home and settled in a new country
with the intention of living there permanently.’
The UNHCR (UN Refugee Agency [2](www.unhcr.org) Describes that ‘migrants
move voluntarily.’  They define a migrant as ’someone who chooses to move
across borders, not because of persecution or serious harm, but for other
reasons like work, education, or family reunification, and who can return
home safely.’
Based on this, anyone born outside of the city (within the UK, or
overseas) who now resides in Sheffield, is a migrant, whilst anyone who
moves to a new country with the intention of settling there permanently,
is an immigrant.
This makes the scope of the request, as defined, impossible to answer.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [3]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[4]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
